item.title: Tylee add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "The belief in a supernatural source of evil is not necessary; men alone are quite capable of every wickedness." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Tylee add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Tylee add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Faith may be defined briefly as an illogical belief in the occurrence of the improbable." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Tylee add a quote by Eric Hoffer
item.description: "The opposite of the religious fanatic is not the fanatical atheist but the gentle cynic who cares not whether there is a god or not." -- Eric Hoffer

item.title: Tylee add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Tylee add a quote by Marie Curie
item.description: "Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less." -- Marie Curie

item.title: Tylee add a quote by Matt Frewer
item.description: "Never knock on Death's door: ring the bell and run away! Death really hates that!" -- Matt Frewer

item.title: Tylee add a quote by Henri Poincare
item.description:
"<i>Le savant doit ordonner ; on fait la science avec des faits comme une maison avec des pierres ; mais une accumulation de faits n'est pas plus une science qu'un tas de pierres n'est une maison.</i>
The Scientist must set in order. Science is built up with facts, as a house is with stones. But a collection of facts is no more a science than a heap of stones is a house." -- Henri Poincare

item.title: Tylee add a quote by Ellen DeGeneres
item.description: "The only thing that scares me more than space aliens is the idea that there aren't any space aliens. We can't be the best that creation has to offer. I pray we're not all there is. If so, we're in big trouble." -- Ellen DeGeneres

item.title: Tylee add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "We forfeit three-fourths of ourselves in order to be like other people." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Tylee add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "It is even harder for the average ape to believe that he has descended from man." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Tylee add a quote by Lily Tomlin
item.description: "Reality is a crutch for people who can't cope with drugs." -- Lily Tomlin

item.title: Tylee add a quote by Thomas H. Huxley
item.description: "The science, the art, the jurisprudence, the chief political and social theories, of the modern world have grown out of Greece and Rome—not by favour of, but in the teeth of, the fundamental teachings of early Christianity, to which science, art, and any serious occupation with the things of this world were alike despicable." -- Thomas H. Huxley

item.title: Tylee add a quote by Brendan Gill
item.description: "Not a shred of evidence exists in favor of the idea that life is serious." -- Brendan Gill

item.title: Tylee add a quote by John Buchan
item.description: "An atheist is a man who has no invisible means of support." -- John Buchan
